smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function migrate2To3 is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function deletesPreviousDownloads is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function movesAssetsToCorrectLocationAndUpdatesPermissions is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class AppsStartupFsmTest is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class AppListFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class ServerService is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'AppListAdapter' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'SessionListFragment' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

Class 'MainActivity' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'AppsStartupFsm' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (listOf()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: listOf()
Parentheses in (localFileLocator.findAppDescription(app.name)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: localFileLocator.findAppDescription(app.name)

Parentheses in (grantResults.isNotEmpty() &&
                        grantResults[0] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                        grantResults[1] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: grantResults.isNotEmpty() &&
                        grantResults[0] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                        grantResults[1] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED

Parentheses in (grantResults.isNotEmpty() &&
                        grantResults[0] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                        grantResults[1] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: grantResults.isNotEmpty() &&
                        grantResults[0] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                        grantResults[1] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED
Parentheses in (activities.size > 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activities.size > 0

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
            Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&

            ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
                    Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
            Manifest.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&

            ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
                    Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED
Parentheses in (app.supportsCli && !app.supportsGui) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: app.supportsCli && !app.supportsGui
Parentheses in (!app.supportsCli && app.supportsGui) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: !app.supportsCli && app.supportsGui
Parentheses in (it.name.contains("rootfs.tar.gz")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.name.contains("rootfs.tar.gz")
Parentheses in (Index(value = ["name"], unique = true)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Index(value = ["name"], unique = true)

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
